definition: distance apart/separated by a given distance
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
at a distance of/distance/to be apart

sentences.english: Certainly the German spearheads were very close.
sentences.chinese: 德國的先頭部隊一定相距很近。

sentences.english: Although China and Saudi is thousands of kilometers away, the people in both countries have intercourse since long ago.
sentences.chinese: 中國和沙特雖相距數千公里，但兩國人民早有來往。

sentences.english: This was so far from what the company was doing that nobody minded.
sentences.chinese: 這類工作與公司的業務相距甚遠，因此沒人介意。

sentences.english: To refer to a toilet as a “rest room” is miles apart from the Chinese idea of a toilet.
sentences.chinese: “休息室”與中文廁所的概念相距十萬八千里。

sentences.english: This is still far from being the case and efforts have to be reinforced in this area.
sentences.chinese: 而現狀還相距甚遠，在這個領域還須做出更大努力。

sentences.english: The canal connects Beijing with Hangzhou, 800 miles to the south.
sentences.chinese: 大運河連接北京和南方的杭州，兩地相距800英里。

sentences.english: The two islands were 1 kilometer away from each other; most of residents on them were fishermen.
sentences.chinese: 兩個海島相距僅約1公里，島上居民主要從事捕魚。

sentences.english: The two places are 10 li apart.
The tree is ten paces from the house.
Ruutel said that despite the remote distance between Estonia and China, the two countries are familiar to each other.
sentences.chinese: 呂特爾表示，愛中兩國相距遙遠，但彼此並不陌生。

sentences.english: Interstellar flight is so daunting because of the vast distances separating stars.
sentences.chinese: 星際飛行十分艱鉅，因爲恆星相距遙遠。

sentences.english: No matter how far apart we are, my thought always find their way back to you.
sentences.chinese: 無論我們相距多麼遙遠，我的思念總在你的身邊。

sentences.english: Even from here she could see the wounds were fresh.
sentences.chinese: 即使相距甚遠，她也可以看出那都是新傷。

sentences.english: The terms do not come anywhere near your expectations.
sentences.chinese: 每一項條款都與你的預期相距甚遠。

sentences.english: The other half of his life seemed infinitely remote from obscenity.
sentences.chinese: 他的另一半生活好像與傷風敗俗相距甚遠。

definition: separated by (distance or time etc)
distance/CL:個|个[ge4]/to be apart from
at a distance of/distance/to be apart
surname Li
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲
far apart
furthest/most distant/at maximum distance
kilometer
neighbor/adjacent
very close/very near
route/path traveled/distance traveled/course (of development)
neighbor/next-door neighbor/near/next to
to separate/to partition/to stand or lie between/at a distance from/after or at an interval of
to merge with/interlinking/to join with/to interlock
to be right next to/to lean closely against
to be almost within reach/to be close at hand
gap/interval/compartment/to divide/to separate/to leave a gap of (two weeks, three meters etc)
